Strong wage growth offers a buffer, suggesting household finances might be weathering the storm better than anticipated, though student loan defaults pose a risk.

Regionally, managers remained bullish on North America, added exposure to Japan, and pared positions in Europe and Hong Kong.

This move aligns with BAT's strategy to reduce debt and achieve its 2026 financial targets. BAT CEO confirmed the holding wasn't strategic, acquired during the hotel business demerger from ITC Limited.

items.summary: Hindustan Unilever Ltd (HUL) has set December 5, 2025, as the record date for the demerger of its ice-cream business into Kwality Wall’s (India) Limited (KWIL). This strategic move aims to unlock value by separating the high-growth ice-cream segment. The demerger is scheduled to be effective December 1, 2025, with KWIL expected to list in February 2026.

items.summary: Reliance Industries' credit rating has been upgraded to 'A-' by S&P Global Ratings, citing improved cash flow stability and a strong earnings outlook driven by its consumer-facing businesses. The agency anticipates prudent financial management and expects earnings growth to outpace high capital expenditure, maintaining a stable outlook.

items.title: Nifty 50 to be around 26,200 by December-end, says Jimeet Modi; suggests long-term investors to buy small-caps on dips
items.summary: Jimeet Modi, CEO of SAMCO Group, anticipates Nifty will remain range-bound, with a possible movement of ±500 points by December and ±1,000 points by March 2026. He suggests focusing on large caps for stability while long-term investors should accumulate quality small caps on dips.

items.title: Russia's Rosatom delivers nuclear fuel to Kudankulam plant
items.summary: Russia's state nuclear corporation has delivered the initial nuclear fuel for the third reactor at India's Kudankulam plant. This marks a significant step in expanding the plant's capacity. The delivery coincides with Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to New Delhi.

items.title: India, Oman hold 14th Strategic Consultative Group meeting
items.summary: India and Oman held their 14th Strategic Consultative Group meeting in Muscat. Discussions covered political, defense, security, trade, and cultural ties. Both nations reaffirmed their commitment to deepening bilateral cooperation. The next meeting will be held in New Delhi.

Telangana CM Revanth Reddy announces Adilabad airport will be completed in a year; to launch Airbus services
items.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy announced significant development plans for Adilabad district. The new Adilabad airport will be completed within a year, with Airbus services to follow. A new university will also be established. The Chief Minister emphasized strengthening irrigation, education, and communication facilities.

items.title: Formulations driving drug export growth: Pharmexcil chairman Namit Joshi
items.summary: Indian pharmaceutical exports are set to reach a new high of $32 billion this fiscal year. This growth is driven by formulations, especially in Europe, Africa, and Latin America. Despite challenges in the US market and global quality checks, the industry shows resilience. Steady demand and normalizing supply chains support this positive outlook.

items.title: The path to a greener electricity grid may be paved with good intentions but we mustn’t set targets in stone
items.summary: Solar and wind capacity in India have been on the rise. However, moving to cleaner electricity is a highly complex challenge that calls for optimal costs and a broadly equitable market. Some flexibility in target setting would ease the country’s path.

items.summary: HUL Demerger LIVE Updates: Hindustan Unilever demerger record date is today, 5 December 2025. From today, HUL shares will trade ex-ice cream business, Kwality Wall’s (India). As per the scheme, the FMCG major will transfer all its ice-cream brands to the newly formed entity.

items.title: Making of luxury car: Not just price, time & experience matter too
items.summary: New car prices are soaring, with luxury vehicles driving the increase. Carmakers are now redefining luxury. It's not just about cost or fancy materials. Brands are building communities and respecting buyers' time. Personalization and exclusive access to leadership are key. This shift focuses on customer experience and individual preferences.

items.title: GSK India plans big 'reinvention', MD Bhushan Akshikar reveals
items.summary: GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals is planning a major comeback in India. The company aims to double its revenue to ₹8,000 crore within the next 4-5 years. This growth will be driven by a strategic shift towards specialty drugs in oncology and liver diseases. Adult vaccination is also a key focus area.

items.title: India bucks global trend, traditional media is set to touch $22.9 bn by 2029: PwC report
items.summary: India's media and entertainment sector is booming, outpacing global trends. Both digital and traditional media are expanding significantly. Digital media is the fastest growing segment, driven by internet advertising and OTT streaming. Traditional media, including television and print, also shows robust growth. The gaming industry is adapting to new formats.

items.title: Smartphones turn dearer as memory chip prices surge
items.summary: Smartphone memory prices are surging, forcing brands to raise device costs. Storage and memory module prices will continue to climb through 2026. This impacts demand, especially for budget smartphones.  Brands like Vivo, Oppo, and Realme are increasing prices on existing inventory and new launches.  This trend is expected to persist into the first half of next year.

items.title: Putin’s India visit: Can India-Russia bonhomie jeopardise the potential India-US trade deal? Experts debate
items.summary: As Russian President Vladimir Putin visits India, experts debate the potential implications for an India-US trade deal. The Russian President has stated that the India-Russia relationship is centred on safeguarding their mutual interests without harming others.

This move is a significant step in the government's privatization efforts for the lender. Talks with potential suitors are advanced, with a formal bidding process expected soon.

The central bank maintained its neutral stance while revising inflation forecast for FY26 downward to 2 per cent from 2.6 per cent earlier, and raising growth projection to 7.3 per cent from 6.8 per cent. The RBI also announced open market operat

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | Can any government really keep young teens off social media? All eyes are on Australia
items.summary: Australia expects to protect children with its social media ban that Meta has begun to comply with, but the internet rarely bends to rules. Social media is addictive—and that’s one reason under-16s may seek workarounds, potentially leaving us clueless of the ban’s efficacy.

items.title: Old silver turns source of new riches as consumers offload 100 tonnes of metal in one week
items.summary: Indians sold an estimated 100 tonnes of old silver in one week, driven by record-high prices and seasonal demand for cash. This surge, far exceeding typical monthly sales, indicates a significant profit-taking opportunity for households. Analysts predict further price increases due to a widening supply deficit.

items.title: RBI rate decision: Pause, cut — or just punt? Five signals to watch for today
items.summary: The RBI policy comes in the backdrop of record-low inflation, surprisingly strong real GDP numbers, weakening nominal growth and rising external risks. Here are five things to track in the policy

items.summary: Byju Raveendran's indirect influence over Aakash through Beeaar Investco has cast doubt on the legality of the test-prep institution's latest rights issue.&nbsp;

items.title: VCs favour technologists, not hustlers, in India’s new AI, deep-tech wave
items.summary: Startups spun out of IITs, research labs, and patent-heavy teams are attracting more funding as investors prioritise technical depth over execution-first founders.

items.title: Microsoft plans bigger data centre investment in India beyond 2026, to keep hiring AI talent
items.summary: Ahead of Satya Nadella’s India visit, Microsoft’s Puneet Chandok said AI adoption is scaling fast, data centre investments will go beyond the $3 billion planned through 2026, and upskilling will shape future jobs.

items.title: Corporates usually wait for RBI rate decision before bond offers. Not this time
items.summary: Bond issuers are breaking from past trends to flood the market with paper amid uncertainty about a rate cut, a weakening rupee, and a high supply of central and state government debt.

items.title: Falling rupee should cheer exporters; so why is no one smiling?
items.summary: While a weaker rupee typically enhances export competitiveness, its 5% depreciation this year to become Asia's worst-performing currency is proving to be a weak cushion against the 50% punitive tariffs that the US president unleashed on key Indian goods in August.

items.title: Africa’s Croesus Aliko Dangote inspired by Reliance; now seeks to rival Jamnagar refinery
items.summary: Nigerian multi billionaire businessman, also the richest in Africa is hero to some and monopolist to others. He is seeking India Inc’s help again for ramp up his $20 billion Lagos complex biggest in world with throughput of 1.4 mn barrels a day.

items.title: Owner of NYC’s Fordham Landing Housing Project Files Bankruptcy
items.summary: The owner of Fordham Landing, a major housing development in the Bronx that’s attracted state investment, has filed bankruptcy to halt a foreclosure sale.

items.title: Faulty glucose monitors linked to 7 deaths and more than 700 injuries, FDA warns
items.summary: Faulty glucose monitors linked to 7 deaths and more than 700 injuries, FDA warns

items.title: Banker Bonus Pools Rise 15% at Canada’s Big Lenders in Busy Year
items.summary: Canada’s biggest lenders set aside 15% more for banker bonus pools in fiscal 2025, a year when the firms’ capital-markets divisions were more active on deals and US President Donald Trump’s policy swings kept trading desks busy.

items.title: 'State tenders to be key in RE capacity addition'
items.summary: "There are multiple routes and one of the primary instruments is going to be the tenders floated by the states," Sarangi said while addressing the session on energy transition at CII India Edge.

items.title: Road Ministry taps IIT-Kanpur to fix 'black spots' on highways to prevent accidents
items.summary: India's Ministry of Road Transport and Highways is partnering with IIT-Kanpur to leverage AI for identifying and analyzing high-risk road "black spots." This initiative aims to understand the root causes of repeated collisions on national highways and implement targeted solutions. The project seeks to improve accident data analysis and reporting to significantly reduce road crashes by 2030.

items.title: Toyota pitches for ethanol hybrids as India looks at electric future
items.summary: Offering tax relief and emission norm benefits to flex-fuel vehicles can help in pushing manufacturers to popularize such vehicles, Vikram Gulati, Toyota’s country head, told Mint.

items.title: Health & national security cess only on demerit goods like pan masala, not essentials, says Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: A new health and national security cess will be imposed on demerit goods like pan masala. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated this cess will not affect essential commodities. The collected revenue will create a dedicated fund for health and national security. This move aims to deter consumption of certain products. The bill has received parliamentary approval.

items.title: Sberbank plans to go big in India, move rupee surplus into G-Secs
items.summary: Sberbank, which processes the largest share of India-Russia trade payments, is also looking at channelling rupee surplus of its investors into government securities, said Herman Gref, CEO and chairman of the executive board. The bank is also considering the export of gold to India, having secured a licence to do so. It's also examining entry into the education and healthcare sectors.

items.title: India, Russia eye trade boost with more diversified basket
items.summary: India and Russia aim to double bilateral trade to $100 billion by 2030, focusing on diversifying exports beyond current levels. Both nations are actively seeking to address the significant trade imbalance, with New Delhi identifying opportunities in consumer goods, automobiles, and electronics. Russia is keen to increase India's share in its imports, offering support for Indian businesses.

items.title: Fitch raises FY26 growth forecast to 7.4% from 6.9%
items.summary: Fitch Ratings has boosted India's economic growth forecast for FY26 to 7.4 percent. This upgrade is driven by robust consumer spending and recent Goods and Services Tax reforms. The agency anticipates the Indian Rupee will strengthen against the dollar. Falling inflation provides room for the Reserve Bank of India to further reduce policy rates.

items.title: To become global reinsurance hub, GIFT City must offer global regularity clarity
items.summary: To be sure, GIFT City already extends several benefits to reinsurers seeking to make this an operational hub. It offers no additional capital injection requirement, a 10-year tax holiday, and significantly lighter staffing and regulatory obligations than onshore India, where full-fledged operations demand a CEO, CFO, chief compliance officer and strict key managerial personnel norms.

items.title: Suzlon unveils plan for three new AI-enabled smart blade units
items.summary: Suzlon Energy is launching three new AI-powered smart blade factories. This expansion will boost its manufacturing capabilities across India. The new facilities aim to improve blade quality and production efficiency. Suzlon is also upgrading its existing plants. This strategic move supports its large order book and strengthens its position in India's growing wind energy sector.

items.title: IndiGo to cut flights from December 8; targets full restoration by February 2026
items.summary: IndiGo will cut flights starting December 8. The airline expects to fully restore flight operations by February 10, 2026. This comes after recent disruptions. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation reviewed the situation with IndiGo officials. Planning gaps in Flight Duty Time Limitations norms caused crew requirement issues. More cancellations may occur soon.

items.title: Amazon Qcomm plans to have 300 dark stores by year-end
items.summary: Amazon is accelerating its 10-minute delivery push in India. The e-commerce giant is adding two dark stores daily. It plans to have 300 micro warehouses across Bengaluru, Mumbai, and Delhi-NCR by the end of this year. This expansion comes amid intense competition in the quick-commerce market.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh to get India's 1st 6 GW solar ingot-wafer unit
items.summary: India's first integrated 6 GW solar photovoltaic ingot and wafer manufacturing plant will be established in Anakapalli, Andhra Pradesh, by ReNew Photovoltaics. This ₹3,990 crore greenfield unit aims to reduce reliance on Chinese imports and bolster India's solar capacity targets. The project, supported by the PLI scheme, is expected to create 1,200 jobs and commence commercial production by January 2028.

items.title: Lenovo mobile phones, PCs clock 68% growth
items.summary: Lenovo Group witnessed a significant 68% surge in its Indian PC and mobile business last fiscal year, driven by a remarkable 150% jump in smartphone sales. The company's total consumer revenue reached ₹27,424 crore, with strong demand fueled by digitization, premiumization, and GST cuts. Lenovo India's profit after tax also saw a healthy 24% increase.

items.title: Working to reduce cascading impact of delays: IndiGo extends apology for flight disruptions
items.summary: India's largest airline, IndiGo, has apologized for widespread operational disruptions and delays over the past two days. The airline is collaborating with aviation authorities and airport operators to mitigate the cascading impact and restore normal operations. IndiGo advises customers to check flight status before traveling.

items.title: RBI scraps old lending curbs, downplays risk to corporate bond volumes
items.summary: The RBI repealed its 2016 guidelines limiting large borrowers' access to bank loans, and pushing them to borrow from the debt market. This change is expected to enhance corporate borrowing capacity, potentially allowing banks to lend an additional  ₹3-4.5 trillion.

items.title: IndiGo says it ‘misjudged’ new crew rules, assures full stability by 10 February
items.summary: The development follows unruly, chaotic scenes at airports nationwide on Thursday, as IndiGo struggled to manage irate travellers across airports. Protests broke out across terminals and fistfights were reported in Kolkata, prompting CISF intervention in Bengaluru and Mumbai.

items.title: Government proposes new spectrum sharing rule for telcos under new rules
items.summary: As per the illustration given in the latest draft rule, a service provider holding frequencies in a different band can share them with other operators having spectrum in a separate band but within the same category and telecom circle.

items.title: General Atlantic-backed ASG Eye Hospital eyes  ₹2,000 crore investment for expansion by 2030
items.summary: The Jodhpur-headquartered hospital chain has over 175 hospitals and 200 vision centres across more than 95 cities in India. It is planning to grow its centres to 600-700 in the next four years.

items.summary: Signs definitive agreement to acquire Sharp Sight Eye Hospital chain in ₹400 crore deal

items.title: Brigade Enterprises expands Hyderabad footprint with  ₹477 crore land acquisition in Neopolis
items.summary: The acquisition was made at a price of  ₹118 crore per acre. This transaction represents a total investment of approximately  ₹477 crore and underscores Brigade's deep confidence in the city’s high-potential growth corridor and its strategic goal to scale operations in key metropolitan areas.

items.title: US trade team may visit India next week for talks
items.summary: The visit is crucial as India and the US are working to finalise the first tranche of the BTA amid Washington imposing 50% tariffs on India, of which 25% are penalty for buying Russian energy, effective August 27. So far, five rounds of trade talks have been completed for the BTA.

items.title: India-Russia ties remain time-tested and resilient: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Speaking at the India-Russia Business Summit, commerce minister Piyush Goyal acknowledged that the relationship is underpinned by deep cultural connections, citing classic Hindi films cherished in Russia.

items.title: Tata Power expects Mundra plant operations to resume by Dec 31
items.summary: The facility has remained shut since July for technical overhauling and maintenance activities

items.title: RBI asks Banks to have systems to monitor and address  risks emanating from exposure to ultra-large borrowers
items.summary: While banks may define their own criteria for identifying an ultra-large borrower, they shall also consider the overall indebtedness of such entities to the banking system, as per RBI directions

items.title: IndiGo cancels over 550 domestic and international flights on Thursday
items.summary: IndiGo cancelled over 550 flights on Thursday amid operational disruptions, affecting domestic and international travel for hundreds of passengers. Punctuality dropped to 19.7 percent, down from 35 percent on Tuesday. The airline cited crew shortages and technical issues, and is implementing pre-planned cancellations while working to normalise operations, according to DGCA and company sources.

items.title: Dream11 pivots to sports entertainment, targets watch party experiences
items.summary: The company, with more than 250 million registered users on its platform, expects to capture a significant portion of the ‘watch party’ experience, or people watching streaming content, which India is likely to see explode in the sports segment.

items.title: SEBI proposes delta-based limits for index options to curb concentration risks
items.summary: Move aims to plug gaps in current system; seeks public feedback by Dec 26

items.title: India urges Russia to approve 32 seafood processing units for supplies
items.summary: India welcomed Russia’s approval of 128 seafood processing units for exports, calling it a sign of growing trust. Fisheries Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh urged Moscow to clear the remaining 32 units and lift temporary suspensions to further boost trade. Expanded access will benefit 30 million fishery-linked livelihoods, diversify exports, and strengthen India’s position as a leading global seafood producer.

items.title: Paramount raises Warner Bros breakup fee to $5 billion — who are the bidders in acquisition race?
items.summary: Paramount Skydance Corp has increased its breakup fee offer to $5 billion in its attempt to acquire Warner Bros Discovery Inc, signalling confidence in regulatory approval. Warner Bros is considering offers from two other bidders. Details here.

items.title: IndiGo flight disruptions: Aviation Minister instructs airline to normalize operations at the earliest
items.summary: Amid widespread disruptions across India, Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu has instructed IndiGo to normalize the operations at the earliest, adding that airport operators need to provide all the support to stranded passengers.

items.title: RBI issues amendments to update various regulations
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has amended the Large Exposures Framework and Intragroup Transactions guidelines, directing banks to manage concentration risks and monitor ultra-large borrowers. Additional amendments cover credit facilities for jewellers and require more frequent, accurate reporting of credit information from banks and NBFCs to Credit Information Companies, enhancing the quality and timeliness of data used for credit assessment and monitoring.

items.title: Retailers suggest a 'one nation, one retail licence' policy to ease compliance
items.summary: The retail industry needs a "plethora of licences to operate," said Spencer Retail CEO Anuj Singh, while speaking at a panel in IndiaEdge 2025, organised by industry body CII.

items.title: IMF did not question GDP growth figures: Nirmala Sitharaman on lower grade on national accounts
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the IMF praised India’s healthy economic performance and did not question its growth figures. The ‘C’ grade assigned to national accounts data was due to the outdated 2011-12 base year. India will adopt 2022-23 as the new base year from February 27, 2026, ensuring more accurate GDP and GVA calculations.

items.title: ‘Premiumisation driving growth in beauty, personal care industry’
items.summary: As per estimates, more than 226 million consumers are expected to purchase beauty products online in 2025, rising to 272 million by 2027. Direct-to-consumer sales are accelerating even faster, confirming the growing importance of omnichannel strategies

items.title: High-stakes hug: Modi, Putin set to discuss trade deficit, defence deals, West’s sanctions
items.summary: Russian delegation is in India with a specific purpose of increasing supplies of Indian goods, says Maxim Oreshkin from Russia’s Presidential Office

items.title: DGCA orders IndiGo to submit action plan, fortnightly progress reports as cancellations spike; says monitoring situation
items.summary: IndiGo has been ordered by the DGCA to submit a detailed action plan and fortnightly progress reports as flight cancellations hit 170–200 a day. The Civil Aviation Ministry is closely monitoring the disruptions, while the regulator also asked IndiGo to propose FDTL relaxations and expedite steps to restore normal operations.

items.title: DGCA may give waiver to IndiGo from new pilot rest rules
items.summary: IndiGo is likely to receive a partial waiver from the DGCA on new pilot rest-duty norms after a severe operational meltdown forced over a thousand flight cancellations. The second phase of the rules, effective from November, limits night landings and significantly increased crew requirements. IndiGo, which failed to plan for the transition, is now facing a pilot shortage due to inadequate hiring and delayed training.

items.title: SEBI, MIIs begin work on second phase of new FPI portal
items.summary: A committee explores options beyond login features and holdings visibility; transaction capability ruled out for now

items.title: Revised BSBD A/c norms: Provision of digital banking and no fee on ATM card
items.summary: This may prompt conversion of some SB A/Cs into BSBD A/Cs

items.title: Not just Russia, another trade boost is loading for India
items.summary: India and Canada are reviving stalled trade talks as Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and his Canadian counterpart Maninder Sidhu begin preparations to launch negotiations on the long-pending CEPA pact. The move comes as India seeks new markets amid Trump-era tariffs and a rapidly shifting global trade landscape. items.title: Share Market Highlights: Markets end marginally higher; Sensex closes at 85,265, Nifty at 26,034
items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty updates on 4 December 2025: Benchmark indices ended slightly higher on Thursday as investors stayed on the sidelines ahead of the Reserve Bank of India’s monetary policy outcome on Friday. The Sensex rose 158.51 points to close at ₹85,265.32, while the Nifty gained 47.75 points to end at 26,033.75.

Market breadth remained weak with 1,817 stocks advancing, 2,303 declining, and 182 remaining unchanged out of 4,302 traded. As many as 80 stocks hit 52-week highs, while 261 touched new lows. 157 stocks were locked in upper circuit, whereas **211 slipped into lower circuit.

items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty updates on 3 December 2025:  India’s benchmark indices extended losses for the fourth straight session on Wednesday, weighed down by delays in the US trade deal and a record-low rupee. Sensex closed at 85,106.81, slipping 31.46 points or 0.04%, after touching an intraday low of 84,763.64. The Nifty 50 declined 46.20 points (0.18%) to settle at 25,986. The Indian rupee ended at a record closing low of 90.19 per U.S. dollar, down 0.36% from the previous close.
